thread.title: Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority Thailand sign new agreement to boost tourism
thread.title_full: Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority Thailand sign new agreement to boost tourism

author: mich@girlracer.me.uk (Michelle Chenery)
title: Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority Thailand sign new agreement to boost tourism
text:
Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority Thailand sign new agreement to boost tourism Etihad Airways and Tourism Authority Thailand sign new agreement to boost tourism Details Category: Airport & Airline   12:30 Etihad Airways, the national airline of the United Arab Emirates, and The Tourism Authority of Thailand (TAT) has signed a landmark USD1.25 million agreement to increase tourism to Thailand. Under the new agreement, the Abu Dhabi-based airline and TAT will jointly promote travel to Thailand from priority markets including the United Arab Emirates, UK, Ireland, Belgium, France, Germany, Italy, Spain, Switzerland, South Africa, Iran and Kuwait. 
The agreement was signed by Etihad Airways Senior Vice President Marketing, Mr Shane O’Hare, and TAT’s Acting Governor Mrs Juthaporn Rerngronasa at a commemorative event in the Etihad Airways-Alitalia Pavilion at Expo Milan 2015. They were joined by H.E. Kobkarn Wattanavrangkul, Thailand’s Minister of Tourism and Sports and high-ranking officials from both organisations. Mr O’Hare said: “Etihad Airways has a long and proud association with Thailand – in fact Bangkok was one of our first international routes. It continues to be one of the busiest in our network enjoying strong year-round demand, particularly from the UAE, GCC, Middle East, Africa and Europe. “With five daily flights to Thailand – four to Bangkok and one to Phuket – Etihad Airways has a significant investment in Thai tourism and the new agreement with Tourism Authority of Thailand supports and extends that commitment. “Through innovative joint marketing campaigns, we aim to bring hundreds of thousands of first-time and repeat travellers from Europe and the Middle East to Thailand to enjoy this beautiful country and to experience the warm, friendly hospitality for which the Thai people are world-renowned.” Mrs Juthaporn Rerngronasa said: “Europe has long been a prime market for Thailand. We have also seen an increase in visitors from the Middle East and Africa. The new partnership with Etihad Airways will be a great benefit to both parties – to Thailand in terms of increased visitor numbers and to Etihad Airways in terms of promoting its international network.” In 2015, TAT has set a target of 28 million international visitors generating an estimated 1.35 trillion Baht (USD 41 billion). Etihad Airways launched its Bangkok route with daily flights in April 2004. It added a second daily service in June 2006, a third daily flight in April 2012, and a fourth on 1 July 2015. The airline added Phuket to its Thai network in October 2014. Related articles
